newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Adtrans confident of steady dividend.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Adtrans confident of steady dividend.

text.p: South Australian car and truck distributor Adtrans Group Ltd said on Thursday it was hopeful improvements in the retail and building industries would produce a turnaround in the truck market in 1996/97.

Adtrans chairman Graeme Bignell said the board was confident of achieving reasonable profits in the future and maintaining dividend, held at 10.5 cents a share in 1995/96, despite the highly competitive motor vehicle market and continuing tough business conditions throughout Australia.

"Any significant turnaround in the truck market will only flow from improved conditions in the retail sector generally, and in the building industry in particular," he said in a statement. "We are hopeful that will occur during the current financial year," he said.

Adrans reported a net profit of A$4.03 million from A$4.33 million in 1994/95, with a four percent lift in annual sales to A$360.4 million. Bignell said apart from a continuing softness in heavy truck sales, Adtrans had enjoyed generally buoyant trading conditions elsewhere in the Australian motor vehicle market. -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373 1800
